title: Sustainable Egg Harvesting from Bird Nests
brief: Harvest eggs continuously from nesting birds without depleting the source.
steps: Step 1: Locate bird nests during nesting season when birds are actively laying.
Step 2: Remove all but 2-3 eggs from the clutch initially.
Step 3: Mark the 2-3 eggs you leave behind (use charcoal, mud, or scratch marks).
Step 4: The bird will continue laying more eggs to fill the complete clutch.
Step 5: Return periodically to remove only the fresh, unmarked eggs.
Step 6: Always leave the original marked eggs to maintain the bird's laying cycle.
warnings: Do not take all eggs or the bird will abandon the nest.
Parent birds may aggressively defend their nests.
Some bird species are protected by law in non-survival situations.
